results.title: Pins and needles
results.creator_credit: Barbara A. Chobocky, Genni Batterham, Kim Batterham and Documentary Films
results.brief_description: An account of the emotional struggle of a 24 year old woman, Genni Batterham, who contracts Multiple Sclerosis and becomes a paraplegic in less than 18 months. The film examines the attitude and reactions of her parents, husband and society.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barbara A. Chobocky, Genni Batterham, Kim Batterham and Documentary Films

results.title: Pinocchio (Disney)
results.creator_credit: Ben Sharpsteen, Hamilton Luske, Walt Disney, RKO Radio Pictures and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: This inspiring tale about the magical powers of believing in your dreams is a timeless fantasy that has delighted generations. Winner of two Academy Awards for Best Score and Song, Jiminy Cricket’s “When you wish upon a star.” While kindy toymaker Gepetto sleeps, a blue fairy brings his beloved marionette Pinocchio to life. With the help of his wise friend Jiminy Cricket, Pinocchio begins a voyage that will test his loyalty, bravery and honesty- virtues he must learn to become a real boy. Features the voices of Mel Blanc, Don Brodie, Walter Catlett, Cliff Edwards and others.

results.title: Pingu: Pingu and his friends
results.creator_credit: PINGU B V NL and Pingu Filmstudio
results.brief_description: Pingu and his family and friends invite you to join them in ten of their stories of fun and games. Stories on the tape include: ‘Pingu plays ice hockey’; ‘Pingu and Pinga don’t want to go to bed’; ‘Pingu on the makeshift skis’; ‘Pingu runs away from home’; ‘Pingu builds an igloo’; ‘Pingu has music lessons from his grandfather’; ‘Pingu in the ice cave’; ‘Pingu’s tobogganing’; ‘Pingu’s grandfather is sick’; ‘Pingu at school’.

results.creator_credit: Otmar Gutman, Pingu Filmstudio and PINGU B V NL

results.title: Ping pong
results.creator_credit: Marcel Carriere and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The National Film Board of Canada filmed the table tennis competition between teams of young Canadians and Chinese that took place in the People’s Republic of China in the summer of 1973, the first time in twenty-five years that such filming was made possible. Shown are highlights of play at the China-Canada Friendship Meet, as well as some of the sightseeing taken in by the young Canadians - a visit, for example, to the Great Wall of China. A film without commentary.

results.title: Pilgrimage of the devil worshippers
results.brief_description: A Kurdistan/Australian co-production. Yazidi villagers go on a pilgrimage annually to the holy shrine of Scheikh-Adi. This film follows the pilgrimage to its destination hidden deep in the Kurdistan valley. Filmed by Georges Drion. Commentary by Rob Antill.

results.title: Pikangikum
results.creator_credit: John Gould, John Kemeny, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In this film, made originally for theatrical use, the mood of the Pikangikum Indian Reserve in northern Ontario is evoked through snatches of dialogue and drawings by John Gould.

results.title: Pies
results.creator_credit: Sheldon Cohen, Caroline Leaf and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Based on a short story by Canadian author Wilma Riley, this animation film is about ethnic prejudice in all its blind viciousness. Mrs. Cherwak is Polish and owns a cow. Mrs. Meuser is a German with entrenched notions of cleanliness. She does not appreciate the cow’s inevitable by-product. The film describes their conflict and its curious resolution over coffee and mincemeat pie. While the author chose to write about the Germans and the Poles she grew up with on the outskirts of Regina, the situation she describes could apply anywhere in the world. (Award: New York.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sheldon Cohen, Caroline Leaf and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Picnic at Hanging Rock (Director's cut) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Hal McElroy, Jim McElroy, Patricia Lovell and McElroy & McElroy
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1900 three girls from a private school and their teacher unaccountably vanish on a St Valentine’s Day school picnic to a mysterious rock in the midst of the Australian bush. The Victorian girls’ school for the daughters of the privileged gradually becomes contaminated and destroyed from within by its inability to understand the forces confronting it. Based on a novel which mythologises the emergence of sexuality, the film atmospherically follows various tangents without distilling a sense of explanation. Unease is evoked by the horror of not knowing. Based on the novel by Joan Lindsay. Cast includes Rachel Roberts, Dominic Guard, Helen Morse and Jacki Weaver. This special 25th anniversary edition is a widescreen, restored director’s cut version containing 7 minutes less footage than original version.

results.title: Pic-nic
results.creator_credit: Stella Babirz, David Atkinson, John Bird, Film Victoria and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: One of the seven deadly sins, gluttony, is explored when a group of aristocrats picnic together. Not content just to eat the food, the guests turn to their classical environment to devour and eventually turn on themselves. An adventure with appetite. Voices by Vanessa Kortlang, Allannah Hill, Noel Crombie, Stella Babirz.
